page.title: 04Wildlife on the Downs
page.content: Wildlife abounds in the region. Although many{hedgerows}have been grubbed up some remain and are the {habitat for a variety of small rodents including{mice,voles,rabbits and hares also{birds}including the more common like{sparrows,robins,tits}and so on and many species of wild flower. Some more{unusual birds}seen include {curlews, stonechats, green sandpipers, {and bramblings.}In some of the wooded areas{bluebells abound in spring. {Primroses and cowslips}can be found as can some types of{orchid}but recently {these have become more rare. If you are lucky{deer}will be seen grazing.These are{mainly roe deer}but both{fallow and muntjak}are in the area. A common sight is the{pheasant which are{bred for 'sport'!! {
